member.summary: Notification content object to display a number on a tile's badge.

member.summary: Default constructor to create a numeric badge content object.

member.summary: Constructor to create a numeric badge content object with a number.
member.param: The number that will appear on the badge. If the number is 0, the badge will be removed. The largest value that will appear on the badge is 99. Numbers greater than 99 are allowed, but will be displayed as "99+".

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.BadgeContent.BadgeNumericNotificationContent.Number
member.summary: The number that will appear on the badge. If the number is 0, the badge will be removed. The largest value that will appear on the badge is 99. Numbers greater than 99 are allowed, but will be displayed as "99+".

member.name: T:NotificationsExtensions.INotificationContentText
member.summary: A type contained by the tile and toast notification content objects that represents a text field in the template.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.INotificationContentText.Text
member.summary: The text value that will be shown in the text field.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.INotificationContentText.Lang
member.summary: The language of the text field. This proprety overrides the language provided in the containing notification object. The language should be specified using the abbreviated language code as defined by BCP 47.

member.name: T:NotificationsExtensions.INotificationContentImage
member.summary: A type contained by the tile and toast notification content objects that represents an image in a template.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.INotificationContentImage.Src
member.summary: The location of the image. Relative image paths use the BaseUri provided in the containing notification object. If no BaseUri is provided, paths are relative to ms-appx:///. Only png and jpg images are supported. Images must be 1024x1024 pixels or less, and smaller than 200 kB in size.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.INotificationContentImage.Alt
member.summary: Alt text that describes the image.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.INotificationContentImage.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Controls if query strings that denote the client configuration of contrast, scale, and language setting should be appended to the Src If true, Windows will append query strings onto the Src If false, Windows will not append query strings onto the Src Query string details: Parameter: ms-contrast Values: standard, black, white Parameter: ms-scale Values: 80, 100, 140, 180 Parameter: ms-lang Values: The BCP 47 language tag set in the notification xml, or if omitted, the current preferred language of the user

member.summary: Creates a WinRT TileNotification object based on the content.
member.returns: The WinRT TileNotification object

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.TileContent.ITileNotificationContent.StrictValidation
member.summary: Whether strict validation should be applied when the Xml or notification object is created, and when some of the properties are assigned.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.TileContent.ITileNotificationContent.Lang
member.summary: The language of the content being displayed. The language should be specified using the abbreviated language code as defined by BCP 47.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.TileContent.ITileNotificationContent.BaseUri
member.summary: The BaseUri that should be used for image locations. Relative image locations use this field as their base Uri. The BaseUri must begin with http://, https://, ms-appx:///, or ms-appdata:///local/.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.TileContent.ITileNotificationContent.Branding
member.summary: Determines the application branding when tile notification content is displayed on the tile.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.TileContent.ITileNotificationContent.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Controls if query strings that denote the client configuration of contrast, scale, and language setting should be appended to the Src If true, Windows will append query strings onto images that exist in this template If false (the default), Windows will not append query strings onto images that exist in this template Query string details: Parameter: ms-contrast Values: standard, black, white Parameter: ms-scale Values: 80, 100, 140, 180 Parameter: ms-lang Values: The BCP 47 language tag set in the notification xml, or if omitted, the current preferred language of the user

member.summary: Base toast notification content interface.

member.summary: Creates a WinRT ToastNotification object based on the content.
member.returns: A WinRT ToastNotification object based on the content.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.StrictValidation
member.summary: Whether strict validation should be applied when the Xml or notification object is created, and when some of the properties are assigned.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.Lang
member.summary: The language of the content being displayed. The language should be specified using the abbreviated language code as defined by BCP 47.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.BaseUri
member.summary: The BaseUri that should be used for image locations. Relative image locations use this field as their base Uri. The BaseUri must begin with http://, https://, ms-appx:///, or ms-appdata:///local/.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Controls if query strings that denote the client configuration of contrast, scale, and language setting should be appended to the Src If true, Windows will append query strings onto images that exist in this template If false (the default, Windows will not append query strings onto images that exist in this template Query string details: Parameter: ms-contrast Values: standard, black, white Parameter: ms-scale Values: 80, 100, 140, 180 Parameter: ms-lang Values: The BCP 47 language tag set in the notification xml, or if omitted, the current preferred language of the user

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.Launch
member.summary: The launch parameter passed into the Windows Store app when the toast is activated.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.Audio
member.summary: The audio that should be played when the toast is displayed.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.Duration
member.summary: The length that the toast should be displayed on screen.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.IncomingCallCommands
member.summary: IncomingCall action buttons will be displayed on the toast if one of the option flags (ShowVideoCommand/ShowVoiceCommand/ShowDeclineCommand) is set to true. To enable IncomingCall toasts for an app, ensure that the Lock Screen Call extension is enabled in the application manifest.

member.name: P:NotificationsExtensions.ToastContent.IToastNotificationContent.AlarmCommands
member.summary: Alarm action buttons will be displayed on the toast if one of the option flags (ShowSnoozeCommand/ShowDismissCommand) is set to true. To enable Alarm toasts for an app, ensure the app declares itself as Alarm capable. The app needs to be set as the Primary Alarm on the PC Settings page (only one app can exist as the alarm app at a given time).
